articles.author: Jeff Stein
articles.title: With Sinema’s help, private equity firms win relief from proposed tax hikes
articles.description: Sen. Kyrsten Sinema (D-Ariz.), a must-have vote for the legislation, insisted on last-minute changes to exempt the industry from a new minimum tax on billion-dollar corporations.
articles.content:

articles.title: U.S. Senate approves bill to fight climate change, cut drug costs in win for Biden
articles.description: The U.S. Senate on Sunday passed a sweeping $430 billion bill intended to fight climate change, lower drug prices and raise some corporate taxes, a major victory for President Joe Biden that Democrats hope will aid their chances of keeping control of Congress…

articles.title: Five Decades in the Making: Why It Took Congress So Long to Act on Climate
articles.description: The Senate bill avoided the political pitfalls of past legislative attempts by offering only incentives to cut climate pollution, not taxes.

articles.title: Israel, Islamic Jihad, say Gaza ceasefire agreement reached
articles.description: A ceasefire between Israel and Islamic Jihad over Gaza appeared to be holding early Monday after going into effect at 11:30 p.m. local time Sunday (4:30 p.m. ET).

articles.author: Dakin Andone and Michelle Watson, CNN
articles.title: One of four Muslim men slain in potentially linked Albuquerque killings remembered as 'brilliant public servant'
articles.description: A 27-year-old Muslim man killed last week in Albuquerque, New Mexico, is being remembered as a "brilliant public servant" committed to "improving conditions and inclusivity for disadvantaged minorities," according to the mayor of the city he worked for.

articles.author: Alastair Gale and Nancy A. Youssef
articles.title: China’s Military Exercises Showcase Modern Fighting Force Preparing for Possible War in the Taiwan Strait
articles.description: The exercises kicked off as an angry Beijing protested the visit to Taipei earlier last week by House Speaker Nancy Pelosi.
articles.content: The exercises kicked off as an angry Beijing protested the visit to Taipei earlier last week by House Speaker Nancy Pelosi.

articles.title: Alex Jones judgment: The cost of lies
articles.description: CBS News legal analyst Rikki Klieman discusses the "whole world of trouble" the conspiracy theorist continues to face for his on-air rants claiming that the 2012 Sandy Hook shooting in which schoolchildren were killed was a hoax.

articles.title: Cincinnati bar shooting leaves at least 9 people injured: police
articles.description: At least people were injured outside a bar in Cincinnati around 1:45 a.m. Sunday morning but none of them are in critical condition. No suspects have been arrested.
articles.content:
A mass shooting in Cincinnati, Ohio early Sunday morning has left at least nine people injured, according to police.
